obfuscation: ﻿According to the number of years that I have studied English , one could assume that I would be able to read , speak , write and communicate with early people without having any massive difficulties .

obfuscation: I really do wish that it would be that simple .
original: I really do wish that it would be that simple.

original: In a way it is true that my English is in a stable state where I am confident to use it in every day basis and also to be able to study dissimilar subjects in English.

obfuscation: Regarding to the fact that I come from Finland and my mother tongue is thus unlike comparing to the other languages explains somehow my incomplete knowledge from foreign languages .

obfuscation: In my native language , Finnish that is , we do not have for example any prepositions or articles .
original: In my native language, Finnish that is, we do not have for instance any prepositions or articles.

obfuscation: These grammar dissimilarities creates insuperable barriers for me that has perhaps something to do with my laziness and a lack of concentration .
original: These grammar dissimilarities creates insuperable barriers for me that has perhaps something to do with my laziness and a lack of concentration.

obfuscation: I presume that I have not even learned the basic things throughout even though language teaching is highly appreciated in Finland .
original: I presume that I have not even learned the basic things throughout even though language teaching is highly appreciated in Finland.

obfuscation: If I start with listening I am happy to inform that this especial skill is presumably my strongest .
original: If I start with listening I am happy to inform that this particular skill is presumably my strongest.

obfuscation: During the few years I have had a chance to be in a kind of environment that people have used different accents and dialects that I have become accustomed to listen .
original: During the few years I have had a chance to be in a sort of environment that people have used different accents and dialects that I have become accustomed to listen.

obfuscation: Certainly I have to admit that even still today I have to apologize occasionally when I am not able to comprehend despite my background afield .
original: Certainly I have to admit that even still today I have to apologize occasionally when I am not able to comprehend despite my background abroad.

obfuscation: But then again it is quite legitimate that I have to ask people to repeat themselves because I am a foreign and I will never become a fully bilingual person .
original: But then again it is quite logical that I have to ask people to repeat themselves because I am a foreign and I will never become a fully bilingual person.

obfuscation: Besides one has to be really careful when listening for example to a strong Scottish accent or if having a conversation with a real Paddy .
original: Besides one has to be really careful when listening for example to a strong Scottish accent or if having a conversation with a real Paddy.

obfuscation: Separations between unlike accents are enormous .

obfuscation: Apparently my reading comprehension is rather good as well .
original: Apparently my reading comprehension is rather good as well.

obfuscation: When reading a newspaper , a magazine or a book I do not need to reach out my dictionary although there are words which meanings I do not have a slightest clue .
original: When reading a newspaper, a magazine or a book I do not need to reach out my dictionary although there are words which meanings I do not have a slightest clue.

obfuscation: But that does not matter because one is able to guess their meaning of the context .
original: But that does not matter because one is able to guess their meaning of the context.

original: Reading in English would be quite simple if having a vast vocabulary because the alphabets are normal if making a comparison to our Scandinavian alphabets.

obfuscation: Usually what happens during the language learning progress is that it is much easier to imbibe passively everything new than produce the new language actively by yourself .
original: Usually what happens during the language learning progress is that it is much easier to imbibe passively everything new than produce the new language actively by yourself.

obfuscation: Generally people might be afraid of using the new language or feel embarrassment if making mistakes .
original: Generally people might be afraid of using the new language or feel embarrassment if making mistakes.

obfuscation: That does not happen to me because I seriously do think that as long as I are able to socialize with people with my incomplete English is all that matters to me .
original: That does not happen to me because I seriously do think that as long as I am able to socialize with people with my incomplete English is all that matters to me.

obfuscation: I do not bother when I realise that I have made some easy mistakes or my pronunciation has not been perfect .
original: I do not bother when I realise that I have made some easy mistakes or my pronunciation has not been perfect.

obfuscation: y writing skills are rather insufficient which really annoys me because when ever I do write essays or even precisely letters to my mates abroad I feel myself disabled .
original: y writing skills are rather insufficient which really annoys me because when ever I do write essays or even just letters to my mates abroad I feel myself disabled.

original: My capacity is not adequate and I do not have any talent for writing and believe me this negativity has nothing to do with my low self-confidence.

obfuscation: The weakest point in my English is the academic writing .
original: The weakest point in my English is the academic writing.

obfuscation: I do not know how to use long and sophisticated words which would link a subordinate clause and a main clause well together .
original: I do not know how to use long and sophisticated words which would link a subordinate clause and a main clause easily together.

obfuscation: The structure in my written English is poor which is sad to admit but that is the truth .
original: The structure in my written English is poor which is sad to admit but that is the truth.

obfuscation: After all these years of studying English and using it in practice and yet not having more fluency with it , leaves me disappointed with a bang-up frustration .
original: After all these years of studying English and using it in practice and yet not having more fluency with it, leaves me disappointed with a great frustration.

obfuscation: The fact is that English is a quite complicated language but still I should have learned it better .
original: The fact is that English is a quite complicated language but still I should have learned it better.

obfuscation: Unfortunately I have come to a conclusion that my knowledge of English will not come to improve .
original: Unfortunately I have come to a conclusion that my knowledge of English will not come to improve.

obfuscation: I have not given up yet and I refuse to do thus in the future but I am sure that this enormous frustration will continue no matter what .
